Parameters:

setValidationQuery

public void setValidationQuery(java.lang.String validationQuery)
If no validationQuery is set, then the validation check returns !isClosed(). This query should be fast and cheap and return at least one (ideally only one) row, something like "select 1 from dual" for Oracle or MySQL. If this DataSource delegates to other non-ManagedConnectionDataSources (like from a JEE container), they should have validation turned off to avoid multiple execution of validation queries.

Parameters:
validationQuery -

setJndiName

public void setJndiName(java.lang.String jndiName)
If jndiName is set, this DataSource will attempt to bind itself in a JNDI Context. Tested w/ Resin 3.1.

Parameters:
jndiName -

setJndiProperties

public void setJndiProperties(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> jndiProperties)
This is exposed as a Map as well as Properties because Spring doesn't allow "ref" in a prop which some users may find restrictive.

Parameters:
jndiProperties -

init

public void init()
          throws java.lang.Exception
Sub-classes that implement init() should make sure to call super.init() to ensure JNDI publication.
